explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 (GHS standards: flash point being less than 23 degC, and initial boiling point being more than 35 degC) based on flash point -17 to -5.6 degC and initial boiling point 57 to 59 degC .

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although the statement of corroding aluminum and iron (ICSC (1993)), since there is no detailed test data, it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Not classified because of SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 14.1 g/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: PATTY(5th, 2001)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on LC50 = 52.5mg/L calculated from rat LC50 = 13000 ppm (equivalent value: 52.5 mg/L) (ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), and rat LC50 = 16000ppm (equivalent value: 91.4 mg/L) (HSDB (2005)), it was classified as Category 5. In addition, the saturated concentration of this product is 3.0*10^5ppm, and it is presumed that the inhalation test is done in the state of steam.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Although there are descriptions that dryness and roughness due to degreasing of the skin take place with the long-term and repetitive exposure of this product (ICSC (J) (1993)), it does not indicate direct skin irritation. There is no concrete data on skin irritation, it cannot be classified because of data insufficiency.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There was description that R36/37 which indicate eye stimulation are applied in European risk phrases. If eye of rabbit is medicated, the moderate irritation of the conjunctival, and a partial swelling will take place immediately (it returns to normal within one week) (IUCLID (2000), "a human eye is stimulated" (ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (5th, 2001), and "redness and pains (ICSC (J), (1993)". So it was set as Category 2A-2B. [Indications] in the case that subdividing are necessary, it is more desirable to be set as Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It gave positive finding by the in vivo DNA junction examination using rats and mice (ACGIH (7th, 2001); ATSDR (1990)), however, it gave negative in the chromosomal aberration test of the in vitro mutagenicity test. And although in some cases it gave negative in the Ames test, it gave generally negative. Therefore we presupposed that we could not categorize it according to the guideline of the classification.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was categorized into A4 according to ACGIH (7th, 2001), and into C according to EPA (1996). So it carried out the outside of category according to classification guidelines.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was considered as out of category based on that in rat inhalation tests, in both mother and child, although it was small, except for the significant decrease feed intake cunsumption and effects to delayed ossification were not observed and teratogenicity also was not observed (ACGIH (7th, 2001), ATSDR (1990), PATTY (5th, 2001)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (liver, kidneys); Category 3 (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (liver, kidneys); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In Priority 1, there is description that there is an anesthetic actions to humans, the influence on the liver and the kidney and respiratory irritation are seen (ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (5th, 2001), ATSDR (1990)), so it is classified into Category 1 (liver, kidney) and Category 3 (an anesthetic actions, respiratory irritation).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (kidneys, liver) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 (kidney, liver) from description of Priority 2 (ICSC (J), (1993), SITTIG (4th, 2002)) that the human kidney and liver may be affected. In addition, although effects on the central nervous systems,renal, and the liver were seen in the animal experiments, all were the results in the amount which exceeds the guidance value range of Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 24-hour TLm=320mg/L of Crustacea (Brine shrimp) (HSDB, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =5040 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
